title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Commission of Investigation (Handling
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Commission of Investigation (Handling 

of Historical Child Sexual Abuse in Day and Boarding Schools) Order 2025.

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 3. A commission is hereby established to -
text_raw:
3. A commission is hereby established to - 

(a) 

investigate the matters, which are considered by the Government 
to be of significant public concern, referred to in the terms of 
reference (the text of which is, for convenience of reference, set 
out in the Schedule) of the commission, and 

(b) make any reports required under the Act in relation to its 

investigation.

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 4. The Minister for Education and Youth is -
text_raw:
4. The Minister for Education and Youth is - 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in

(a) 

specified as the Minister of the Government responsible for

other functions given to him or her under the Act, and 

(b) 

authorised to appoint the member or members of the commission.

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: Terms of Reference
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

Terms of Reference 

Interpretation of Terms 

For the purposes of the within Terms of Reference, the following terms mean as 
follows:- 

child sexual abuse means interaction with a child for sexual gratification. 

handling 

in the context of reasonable concerns of child sexual 
abuse, means actions taken or not taken in response to 
those allegations or reasonable concerns. 

school 

means a school as defined at Section 2(1) of the 
Education Act 1998. 

concerns of child 
sexual abuse 

means concerns which arose where a person witnessed 
actions or behaviours that were inappropriate and gave 
rise or should have given rise to a reasonable suspicion 
or belief that child sexual abuse had occurred; 

or 

became aware of any allegation or information that gave 
rise or should have given rise to a reasonable suspicion 
or belief that child sexual abuse had occurred. 

PART 1 — Investigation
text_norm: schedule term reference interpretation term purpose within term reference following term mean follows - child sexual abuse mean interaction child sexual gratification handling context reasonable concern child sexual abuse mean action taken taken response allegation reasonable concern school mean school defined section 2(1) education act 1998 concern child sexual abuse mean concern arose person witnessed action behaviour inappropriate gave rise given rise reasonable suspicion belief child sexual abuse occurred became aware allegation information gave rise given rise reasonable suspicion belief child sexual abuse occurred part 1 -- investigation

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 1. The Commission is directed to investigate and to make a report to the
text_raw:
1. The Commission is directed to investigate and to make a report to the 
Minister for Education and Youth, in accordance with the provisions of the 
Commissions of Investigations Act 2004, on the following matters of public 
interest: 

(a) The handling by schools, and persons and entities responsible for 
and associated with schools, of concerns of child sexual abuse, 
and in particular: 

(i) 

the identification of failures to treat such concerns in a 
manner which adequately protected children; 

(ii) 

the causes of and responsibility for such failures; and 

(b) The handling by An Garda Síochána, the Health Service 
Executive 
successor and predecessor 
organisations) and the Department of Education and Youth of 
concerns of child sexual abuse reported to them. 

relevant 

(or 

its

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 2. The Commission is also directed to report to the Minister for Education
text_raw:
2. The Commission is also directed to report to the Minister for Education 
and Youth on (a) the impact of sexual abuse upon survivors and (b) learnings for 
the future in relation to child protection. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [388] 5 

PART 2 - Commission's Scope and Approach
text_norm: 2 commission also directed report minister education youth (a) impact sexual abuse upon survivor (b) learning future relation child protection 388 5 part 2 - commission scope approach

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 3. A failure to adequately treat a concern of child sexual abuse will include
text_raw:
3. A failure to adequately treat a concern of child sexual abuse will include 

circumstances where actions taken, or not taken, resulted in: 

(a) 

(b) 

a failure to prevent harm to children; 

the non-reporting of such concerns, whether to appropriate school 
staff, An Garda Síochána, the Health Service Executive (or its 
successor and predecessor organisations) or the Department of 
Education. 

(c) 

the concealment of child sexual abuse.
text_norm: 3 failure adequately treat concern child sexual abuse include circumstance action taken taken resulted (a) (b) failure prevent harm child non-reporting concern whether appropriate school staff garda siochana health service executive (or successor predecessor organisations) department education (c) concealment child sexual abuse

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 4. The Commission, in examining whether handling was adequate, shall
text_raw:
4. The Commission, in examining whether handling was adequate, shall 

have regard to: 

(a) whether applicable laws and guidelines were followed; 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

the use of disciplinary procedures; 

changes of duties or responsibilities, or additional supervision of 
persons suspected of child sexual abuse; 

the references provided to subsequent employers of persons 
suspected of child sexual abuse; 

subsequent employment, or movement of persons suspected of 
child sexual abuse to other schools or institutions, in Ireland or 
elsewhere; 

(f) whether the parents or guardians of a child concerned were 

informed; 

(g) 

the approach taken towards any criminal prosecutions, civil 
litigation or threatened litigation, including the commissioning of 
any reports or investigations into such matters; 

(h) whether there were any co-ordinated actions with regard to child 

sexual abuse in schools by any perpetrators. 

PART 3 - Commission's Working Methodology

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 5. The Commission is directed to submit its final report to the Minister for
text_raw:
5. The Commission is directed to submit its final report to the Minister for 

Education and Youth not later than 5 years after its establishment.
text_norm: 5 commission directed submit final report minister education youth later 5 year establishment

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: In performing its functions the Commission should tailor its processes
text_raw:
6. 

In performing its functions the Commission should tailor its processes 
and methodologies so as to achieve effective investigation and reporting in the 
most timely and cost effective manner possible.
text_norm: 6 performing function commission tailor process methodology achieve effective investigation reporting timely cost effective manner possible

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 7. Recognising that it would be impossible to investigate the handling of
text_raw:
7. Recognising that it would be impossible to investigate the handling of 
every allegation of child sexual abuse that may be reported to the Commission 
and in order to meet the timeline directed, the Commission shall adopt a 
sampling approach as set out in these Terms of Reference and shall exercise its 
discretion in relation to the extent of the evidence that it considers in order to 
draw conclusions and make findings as required by these Terms of Reference.
text_norm: 7 recognising would impossible investigate handling every allegation child sexual abuse may reported commission order meet timeline directed commission shall adopt sampling approach set term reference shall exercise discretion relation extent evidence considers order draw conclusion make finding required term reference

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 8. For its investigation, the Commission shall select samples where
text_raw:
8. For its investigation, the Commission shall select samples where 
concerns of child sexual abuse arise. It shall use a purposive sampling approach 

 
 6 [388] 

to select cases where it appears that there will be sufficient witness and 
documentary evidence available to allow it to fulfil its functions under these 
Terms of Reference. It shall: 

(a) 

conduct an initial survey to identify the potential number of 
survivors and their experiences in relation to concerns of child 
sexual abuse; 

(b) determine, from analysis of this survey, where sufficient evidence 
is likely to be available to allow the Commission to investigate 
the matters required by these Terms of Reference; 

(c) 

select samples for detailed investigation that it considers to be 
representative of particular contexts, such as category of school, 
particular time period, type of school patron and geographic 
location.
text_norm: 8 investigation commission shall select sample concern child sexual abuse arise shall use purposive sampling approach 6 388 select case appears sufficient witness documentary evidence available allow fulfil function term reference shall (a) conduct initial survey identify potential number survivor experience relation concern child sexual abuse (b) determine analysis survey sufficient evidence likely available allow commission investigate matter required term reference (c) select sample detailed investigation considers representative particular context category school particular time period type school patron geographic location

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 9. The Commission shall also take the following matters into consideration
text_raw:
9. The Commission shall also take the following matters into consideration 

in its selection of samples: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the extent of concerns of child sexual abuse established by 
previous investigations including the Scoping Inquiry into 
Historical Sexual Abuse in Day and Boarding Schools Run by 
Religious Orders; 

the extent of criminal convictions of a specific individual or 
related to a specific school; 

the extent of evidence which is needed to make findings and 
recommendations and the likely availability of such evidence; 

the need to complete its work and report to the Minister for 
Education and Youth no later than 5 years after its establishment.

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 10. The Commission of Investigation may consider child sexual abuse that
text_raw:
10. The Commission of Investigation may consider child sexual abuse that 
occurred between 1927 and 2013 in its report, but shall recognise that the longer 
ago matters took place, the greater the realistic limitation on the ability of the 
Commission to conduct a meaningful investigation into those matters. Thus, the 
Commission shall have the discretion to reduce the time period under 
investigation in respect of all or any component part of its investigation or in 
respect of any school, religious order, person or body as it considers appropriate. 
Where the abuse or any matter relating to the abuse in question is the subject of 
ongoing proceedings or statutory processes, the Commission, in exercising its 
discretion, will have regard to such proceedings and processes in deciding 
whether to investigate such matters or the manner of such investigation. 

PART 4 — Survivor Engagement 

The Commission shall strive to be as survivor-centred as possible,
text_norm: 10 commission investigation may consider child sexual abuse occurred 1927 2013 report shall recognise longer ago matter took place greater realistic limitation ability commission conduct meaningful investigation matter thus commission shall discretion reduce time period investigation respect component part investigation respect school religious order person body considers appropriate abuse matter relating abuse question subject ongoing proceeding statutory process commission exercising discretion regard proceeding process deciding whether investigate matter manner investigation part 4 -- survivor engagement commission shall strive survivor-centred possible

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: consistent with fair procedures, and shall promote:
text_raw:
11. 
consistent with fair procedures, and shall promote: 

(a) 

clear communication and transparency, allowing survivors to 
make informed choices as to whether to engage with the 
Commission; 

 
 [388] 7 

(b) 

support for survivors at key stages of the process, including 
emotional and psychological support, and support for those with 
additional needs to facilitate an accessible and inclusive process 
wherever possible; 

(c) 

a trauma-informed approach to working with those who have 
experienced child sexual abuse; 

(d) practical steps 

to mitigate risks of retraumatisation, 

in 

consultation with survivors and relevant expert advice.
text_norm: 11 consistent fair procedure shall promote (a) clear communication transparency allowing survivor make informed choice whether engage commission 388 7 (b) support survivor key stage process including emotional psychological support support additional need facilitate accessible inclusive process wherever possible (c) trauma-informed approach working experienced child sexual abuse (d) practical step mitigate risk retraumatisation consultation survivor relevant expert advice

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 12. The Commission shall establish a Survivor Engagement Programme to
text_raw:
12. The Commission shall establish a Survivor Engagement Programme to 
operate under the auspices of the Commission. It shall hear accounts from 
survivors of the impact of their experiences of having been sexually abused in 
schools, and any documenting of these shall be on an anonymised basis. The 
Survivor Engagement Programme is directed to: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

provide a non-adversarial setting for survivors of child sexual 
abuse to recount the impact of their experiences and for a family 
member of deceased or incapacitated survivors to recount the 
impact of sexual abuse upon their relative. It shall not hold formal 
hearings or conduct a formal legal process, nor act as a public 
inquiry, and it shall not cross-examine those who choose to 
participate; 

engage in relevant research and analysis based on survivors' 
accounts; 

produce and submit a summary report to the Chair of the 
Commission in relation to the impact of survivors' experiences, 
which is anonymised and does not make findings of fact against 
any person or organisation. 

shall design its procedures so as to guard the identity of 
individuals giving accounts 
the Survivor Engagement 
to 
Programme and endeavour to ensure that any person or institution 
referenced in the accounts provided and in any report made 
available shall not be identified. 

PART 5 - Reporting
text_norm: 12 commission shall establish survivor engagement programme operate auspex commission shall hear account survivor impact experience sexually abused school documenting shall anonymised basis survivor engagement programme directed (a) (b) (c) (d) provide non-adversarial setting survivor child sexual abuse recount impact experience family member deceased incapacitated survivor recount impact sexual abuse upon relative shall hold formal hearing conduct formal legal process act public inquiry shall cross-examine choose participate engage relevant research analysis based survivor account produce submit summary report chair commission relation impact survivor experience anonymised make finding fact person organisation shall design procedure guard identity individual giving account survivor engagement programme endeavour ensure person institution referenced account provided report made available shall identified part 5 - reporting

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 13. The Commission may make such findings and further recommendations
text_raw:
13. The Commission may make such findings and further recommendations 
arising out of its investigation relating to the handling of concerns of child sexual 
abuse, and child protection as it sees fit. In its recommendations, the Commission 
may also have regard to the work of the Survivor Engagement Programme.
text_norm: 13 commission may make finding recommendation arising investigation relating handling concern child sexual abuse child protection see fit recommendation commission may also regard work survivor engagement programme

title: AND WHEREAS a draft of the following Order has been laid before each House
heading: 14. On or before the second anniversary of the establishment of the
text_raw:
14. On or before the second anniversary of the establishment of the 
Commission, the Chair shall write to the Minister for Education and Youth to 
either (a) confirm his or her belief that the Commission shall be in a position to 
report within five years of its establishment or (b) to propose any modifications 
to the Terms of Reference of the Commission that will facilitate the achievement 
of that objective.

22 July, 2025. 

MICHEÁL MARTIN, 

Taoiseach.
